qas.question: What did the French believe was instrumental in their defense?
Where was the Russians building a new fort?
Mamelon is found on a hill in front of what suburban commune?
After fighting for weeks, what did the Russians continue to have control over?

context: The Allies had had time to consider the problem. The French being brought around to agree that the key to the defence was <a0_0>the Malakoff<a0_0/>.:441 Emphasis of the siege at Sevastopol shifted to the British left, against the fortifications on Malakoff hill.:339 In March, there was fighting by the French over a new fort being built by the Russians at Mamelon, located on a hill in front of the <a2_0>Malakoff<a2_0/>. Several weeks of fighting saw little change in the front line, and <a3_0>the <a1_0>Mamelon<a3_0/><a1_0/> remained in Russian hands.
